course.subject: CENG
course.name: Transport Phenomena II
course.description: Application of transport phenomena in chemical processes. Fluid flow in pipes and channels. Conductive, forced and free convective, and radiative heat transfer. Diffusive and convective mass transport. Coupling of transport and chemical reactions. Analysis and design of heat exchangers and contacting processes for separation and reaction. Numerical solutions and simulations of complex systems.

reviews.author: babycat
reviews.title: all I can say is that the bell curve saved me
reviews.comment_content:
!! Online Sem Alert !!
A bulk of the semester is spent on heat transfer: radiation (least focus, often negligible), conduction, and convection
Steady state conduction, SS with heat generation, SS on extended surfaces
Unsteady-state conduction
Heat transfer equipment (Q = UAT, log-mean average)
Mass transfer phenomena (similar to heat transfer, but more difficult)
Stationary medium in mass transfer, unsteady-state mass transfer, mass transfer with chemical reactions
reviews.comment_teaching:
His first time teaching so 體諒少少, he probably tried his best but...
Felt like he thought we were way smarter than we actually were
Responds to emails quickly
Will not entertain questions about how to go about doing homework, will only direct you to the topic and advise you to revise it/understand it better
Tutorials conducted by TA, treat as practice. Tutorial covers content at a more relaxed pace than lecture teachings
reviews.comment_grading:
Either he thought we were really smart, or he gave us a lot of difficult questions so he could flatten the bell curve more/ ensure we won't cheat
5% participation (ask questions in class/ find typos)
20% quizzes, excluding lowest 4
20% homework (grading was ok)
25% midterm (the average was 10.5/25 and only after relaxing grading... very strict grading or maybe we were just stupid)
30% final (grading relaxed more since midterm, but again maybe we were just stupid)
reviews.comment_workload:
Quizzes: 10 min MCQ conducted at the beginning of each lecture, for content from last lecture. it was very stressful
Homework: first 2 homeworks involved 5 easy/moderate questions, the next 2 homeworks had 9 difficult questions +1 matlab and we were given a week
Final: split into 3 parts of 40 mins each, with 3 difficult questions in each part. open book but only hardcopy notes. some exam questions were similar to previous homework questions

reviews.author: gr
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of Heat transfer
Differential Equations of heat transfer
1D steady-state heat transfer
Unsteady-state heat transfer
Fundamentals of mass transfer and non-stationary media
Fundamentals of mass transfer and stationary media
Homogeneous chemical reaction and unsteady-state
reviews.comment_teaching: He explains and teaches well but sometimes he seems he is not sure about the answer when we ask some question.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% participation (ask questions in class/ find typos)
20% quizzes, excluding lowest 3 (Every class starts with 10min, 7mc quiz)
20% homework (4 is total, each have 4 questions)
15% midterm
35% final

10% participation that can be earned just by asking questions.
Although, you didn't achieved high score on mid and final exam.
Participation can cover your grade as there are not many students achieving full score on participation.
reviews.comment_workload:
Beside you have to revise before the class due to the everyday quiz,
there is not much assignments to do. 4 Assignments only.

reviews.author: LMM
reviews.title: So Chur
reviews.comment_content:
Heat transfer part:
~>Fundamentals of heat transfer
(cond, conv , rad)
~>Differential equations of heat
transfer
~>1D steady-state
– Plane wall and composite walls
– Hollow cylinder & sphere
– Energy generation
– Energy generation & extended surface
– Extended surface
~>Unsteady state
– lumped parameter
– Bi modulus
– Semi-infinite wall
~> Heat-transfer equipment (heat exchanger)
~> Fundamentals of Mass Transfer & Nonstationary Media
~> Stationary Medium
~> Homogeneous Chemical Reaction and Unsteady-State
reviews.comment_teaching:
Want to teach better but seem so hard
Hope remind teaching session(like reviews) will be add in the future
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Class participation
20% Quizzes (7-10Qs)
(quiz works for attendance check the lowest four scores will be excluded :(( too less )
20% HWs 4HWs 5pt per each
25% Mid-term
30% Final

reviews.author: Binny
reviews.title: 2016-17 Spring Semester Heat & Mass Transfer [Recommended!]
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic concepts of heat transfer modes including conduction, Convection, Radiation

2. Steady state heat transfer with different conditions: a. Contact resistance b. Heat generation
c. Extended surface area

3. Unsteady state heat transfer with a few conditions

4. Mass transfer with a few conditions

5. Dimensional analysis

This course involves mathematics but professor values students' attempts and understanding on the mathematical concepts more than the correct math calculation. Therefore, it is important to understand the mathematics.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Gao does not have electronic lecture notes that she publish before the classes. Therefore, it is recommended to bring notebook to the class to take notes. Nonetheless, her PG TAs upload scanned copy of her notes in case anyone misses her lecture.
Unlike any other professors reading out their slides in HKUST, professor Gao does teach from the scratch and that may make you feel you are in university.
If you find the professor personally, she will help you with questions and guide you through the topics and the way she makes midterm/final questions.
Prof Gao was extremely considerate that she asked us which date my batch prefers to take mid-term exam. Based on the democratic mass voting, one date was chosen.
Professor also gives reviews (Thermodynamics, Fluid mechanics as well as the subject itself) for the student who did not learn these courses yet or who forget to revise after/ before classes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good & fair grading.
Exams are relatively easy if one goes to classes all the time and does his/her assignment by him/herself (without copying).

Better to follow honour code (No cheating, no copying).

When one takes exams, it is recommended to write thought processes or even the name of the laws (e.g. 1st law of thermodynamics) and assumptions (e.g. steady state). Professor values the students' effort and attitude on learning a lot.

Assignment: 10%
Mid-Term: 35%
Final: 55%
reviews.comment_workload: There are a few assignments (Around 5).  Each assignment has enough time for the students to work on. The weight of the assignments is relatively low. This makes the whole course help students understand the concept and practise. It is extremely useful to study the assignments for exams. Therefore, the workload is very low.

reviews.author: Bohr
reviews.title: Tranport Phenomena II: MATH course?
reviews.comment_content:
1. Basic concepts of heat transfer
Three modes:
Conduction, Convection, Radiation
Rate equations

2. Steady state heat transfer
Heat Transfer through plate (Several plates)
Heat Transfer through cylinder (with and without heat generation)
Extended surfaces for heat transfer (好maths 要知道下solve second order ode既技巧)

3. Unsteady state heat transfer
Biot number and its significance
Lamped system analysis (BI <0.1)
Graphical solution

4. Mass transfer
Fick's law of molecular diffusion
Generalized Fick's law (molecular diffusion + mass convection)

5. Dimension analysis
講D dimensionless group 既physical significance

6. Heat Exchanger
log mean temperature (proof)
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂佢會detail咁講D notes
講得好清楚
有時Professor 會幫我地remind下以前thermo fluid (CENG 2210, CENG 2220) d野

Tutorial 會講番堂上講過既野 (可以當溫書用)

E個course, professor 係用first law of thermodynamics, mole/ energy balance 黎proof d公式既 所以相對上會好多maths野(partial derivative, 有d differential equations野)

自己d數學最好備一備身 la (partial derivative, basic differentiation and integration)
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment: 10%
Mid-Term: 35%
Final: 55% (dimensionless group 會比埋你 5洗驚5記得)

Mid term:
出番HW d題目, 不過煩左D
Final:
有D出番HW 題目, 其餘果D全新 有挑戰性
有題出得幾好 (印象中好似係proof thickness of hydrodynamics boundary layer =thickness of thermal boundary layer = thickness of mass transfer boundary layer)

mid-term final盡做la 因為未必做得完
Mid term final 時間好趕 盡量自己事前睇下d proof 自己最好手寫一次先
reviews.comment_workload:
5 assignments
assignment 3 係prepare mid-term 用既
(assignment 幫你溫番D concept)
